intro: Agathisanthemum, commonly known as the golden crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk, giving it a striking appearance. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Agathisanthemum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
